headline: Trump Touts New Microsoft Data-Center Pledges After Local Backlash
summary: Microsoft has promised to pay higher utility bills for all of its U.S. data centers powering artificial-intelligence models, President Trump said Monday, accelerating plans by the tech industry and administration to respond to local fears that AI is pushing up electricity prices.  The software giant “will make major changes beginning this week to ensure that Americans don’t ‘pick up the tab’ for their power consumption,” Trump said on Truth Social.

content.title: Trump Touts New Microsoft Data-Center Pledges After Local Backlash
content.summary: Microsoft has promised to pay higher utility bills for all of its U.S. data centers powering artificial-intelligence models, President Trump said Monday, accelerating plans by the tech industry and administration to respond to local fears that AI is pushing up electricity prices.  The software giant “will make major changes beginning this week to ensure that Americans don’t ‘pick up the tab’ for their power consumption,” Trump said on Truth Social.

headline: Investors back energy providers over big tech for 2026 AI bets, says BlackRock
summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, still believes in the investment case ​for artificial intelligence in the year ahead but ‌will be focusing on broader opportunities, it said on Tuesday.  Investors seeking ‌to play the AI theme into 2026 favour energy and infrastructure providers over Wall Street big tech, BlackRock said in its Investment Directions report, citing a recent investor ⁠survey it conducted.  AI and ‌big tech dominated markets and world equity returns in 2025, but as the multitrillion-dollar ‍race between the likes of Microsoft, Meta and Alphabet to build new data centres generates worries about uncertain returns on capital ​and higher borrowing, investors were looking for new ‌ideas, the BlackRock survey showed.

content.title: Investors back energy providers over big tech for 2026 AI bets, says BlackRock
content.summary: BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, still believes in the investment case ​for artificial intelligence in the year ahead but ‌will be focusing on broader opportunities, it said on Tuesday.  Investors seeking ‌to play the AI theme into 2026 favour energy and infrastructure providers over Wall Street big tech, BlackRock said in its Investment Directions report, citing a recent investor ⁠survey it conducted.  AI and ‌big tech dominated markets and world equity returns in 2025, but as the multitrillion-dollar ‍race between the likes of Microsoft, Meta and Alphabet to build new data centres generates worries about uncertain returns on capital ​and higher borrowing, investors were looking for new ‌ideas, the BlackRock survey showed.

headline: The trillion-dollar IPOs investors are watching for in 2026
summary: Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast.Investors are buzzing over potential $1 trillion tech IPOs in 2026, but which giants will come out on top? In this episode of Stocks in Translation, The Futurum Group Daniel Newman joins host Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma to discuss the potential $1 trillion IPOs of OpenAI and SpaceX. Newman breaks down investor hype, competitive moats, and market risks, while also exploring Google (GOOG) Gemini’s AI gains, Apple's (AAPL) innovation gap, and how Amazon (AMZN) and Meta (META) are positioned to dominate AI in 2026.Check out the full episode here. Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. You can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service. This post was written by Lauren Pokedoff

Check out the full episode here.

headline: Vistra price target raised to $244 from $230 at BMO Capital
summary: BMO Capital raised the firm’s price target on Vistra (VST) to $244 from $230 and keeps an Outperform rating on the shares. The firm is positive on the company’s announcement that it entered into 20-year PPAs with Meta Platforms (META) for about 2,600MW of energy/capacity from its three nuclear plants in PJM to support Meta’s data centers in the region. The announcements notably highlighted the importance of additionality as well as a host of political endorsements from regional politicians, the

headline: AI Data Center Demand Leaves No Stone Unturned With New Geothermal Deal
summary: Geothermal and renewable energy company Ormat Technologies reported late Monday it signed a 20-year power purchase agreement with AI data center designer/builder Switch.  Under the deal, Switch will purchase approximately 13 megawatts of renewable energy from Ormat's Salt Wells geothermal power plant located near Fallon, Nevada.

content.title: AI Data Center Demand Leaves No Stone Unturned With New Geothermal Deal
content.summary: Geothermal and renewable energy company Ormat Technologies reported late Monday it signed a 20-year power purchase agreement with AI data center designer/builder Switch.  Under the deal, Switch will purchase approximately 13 megawatts of renewable energy from Ormat's Salt Wells geothermal power plant located near Fallon, Nevada.
